creator: khammond25@home.com
text:
The user interface allows a user to put elements in TestPlan without having a 
ThreadGroup.  

For example, create a Web Testing element in WorkBench. Save the element to a 
file.  Next, right-click on the TestPlan element and select Open.  Load the 
file you just created.  The Web Testing element is placed in Test Plan and 
there is no ThreadGroup element.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I fixed it for the specific case mentioned here.  However, a more universal
framework needs to be developed to prevent users from doing things JMeter
doesn't like.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I'm going to close this for now, as it appears JMeter is moving in a direction 
that essentially allows almost any type of element to appear almost anywhere in 
a test tree.

Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com

text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
